newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada auto union still hopeful of GM deal.
newsitem.headline: Canada auto union still hopeful of GM deal.

text.p: Contract talks between the Canadian Auto Workers union and General Motors Corp remained stuck on overtime issues but the union said on Tuesday it was still hopeful a deal could be reached today to end a 19-day-old strike by about 26,000 Canadian workers.

Union president Buzz Hargrove told reporters after an early morning caucus meeting that the two sides had settled "95 percent" of contract issues but were still hung up over the union's refusal to accept mandatory overtime at GM's Oshawa assembly plant.
